citation.fr: [{\"type\": \"dataset\", \"id\": \"9e2ddbf2-4846-4807-9ea5-0a12ae6a122c\", \"author\": [{\"literal\": \"Ocean Networks Canada Society\"}], \"issued\": [{\"date-parts\": [\"2024\", \"05\", \"08\"]}], \"abstract\": \"Ce WET Labs ECO FLNTUSB 2473 a \u00e9t\u00e9 d\u00e9ploy\u00e9 le 2012-02-25 au Strait of Georgia East. Strait of Georgia East d\u00e9signe une zone est du le Strait of Georgia. Cet instrument est un Fluorim\u00e8tre et Turbidit\u00e9. Les instruments de fluorim\u00e8tre et turbidit\u00e9 (FLNTU) sont dot\u00e9s d'un capteur combin\u00e9 qui mesure la fluorescence et la turbidit\u00e9 de la chlorophylle dans le m\u00eame volume d'eau de mer. L'instrument utilise une diode \u00e9lectroluminescente (DEL) pour fournir une source d'excitation. La lumi\u00e8re fluorescente est re\u00e7ue par un d\u00e9tecteur \u00e0 un angle particulier \u00e0 partir de la source DEL et utilise un filtre d'interf\u00e9rence pour distinguer la lumi\u00e8re d'excitation dispers\u00e9e. La turbidit\u00e9 est mesur\u00e9e en m\u00eame temps, en d\u00e9tectant la lumi\u00e8re diffus\u00e9e \u00e0 partir d'une DEL, qui est positionn\u00e9e au m\u00eame angle que la fluorescence chlorophylle. Il a \u00e9t\u00e9 deploy\u00e9 sur une plateforme fixe. Les donn\u00e9es de ce d\u00e9ploiement sont archiv\u00e9es et accessibles sur l\u2019infrastructure num\u00e9rique Oceans 3.0 du R\u00e9seau Canadien des Oc\u00e9ans (ONC), avec assurance de la qualit\u00e9 et produits d\u00e9riv\u00e9s selon les conventions \u00e9tablies.\", \"edition\": \"\", \"edition-date\": \"\", \"publisher\": \"\", \"title\": \"Strait of Georgia East Fluorim\u00e8tre et Turbidit\u00e9 d\u00e9ploy\u00e9 2012-02-25\", \"language\": \"fr\", \"URL\": \"http://ckan.onc.uvic.ca/dataset/9e2ddbf2-4846-4807-9ea5-0a12ae6a122c?local=fr\"}]
citation.en: [{\"type\": \"dataset\", \"id\": \"9e2ddbf2-4846-4807-9ea5-0a12ae6a122c\", \"author\": [{\"literal\": \"Ocean Networks Canada Society\"}], \"issued\": [{\"date-parts\": [\"2024\", \"05\", \"08\"]}], \"abstract\": \"The WET Labs ECO FLNTUSB 2473 was deployed on 2012-02-25 at Strait of Georgia East. Strait of Georgia East refers to an eastern area of the Strait of Georgia. This device is a Fluorometer Turbidity. Fluorometer Turbidity instruments measure chlorophyll fluorescence and turbidity within the same volume of seawater. The instrument uses a light emitting diode (LED) to provide an excitation source. The fluoresced light is received by a detector at a particular angle from the LED source, and uses an interference filter to discriminate against scattered excitation light. Turbidity is measured at the same time, by detecting scattered light from a LED, which is positioned at the same angle as the chlorophyll fluorescence. It was deployed on a fixed platform. Data from this deployment were archived and made available through Ocean Networks Canada's Oceans 3.0 digital infrastructure, with quality assurance and derived data products following established practices.\", \"edition\": \"\", \"edition-date\": \"\", \"publisher\": \"\", \"title\": \"Strait of Georgia East Fluorometer Turbidity Deployed 2012-02-25\", \"language\": \"en\", \"URL\": \"http://ckan.onc.uvic.ca/dataset/9e2ddbf2-4846-4807-9ea5-0a12ae6a122c?local=en\"}]

          <mcc:description>
            <gco:CharacterString>The EPSG Geodetic Parameter Dataset is a structured dataset of Coordinate Reference Systems and Coordinate Transformations, accessible through this online registry (www.epsg-registry.org) or, as downloadable zip files, through IOGP's EPSG home page at www.epsg.org. The geographic coverage of the data is worldwide, but it is stressed that the dataset does not and cannot record all possible geodetic parameters in use around the world.</gco:CharacterString>

      <mri:abstract xsi:type="lan:PT_FreeText_PropertyType">
        <gco:CharacterString>The WET Labs ECO FLNTUSB 2473 was deployed on 2012-02-25 at Strait of Georgia East. Strait of Georgia East refers to an eastern area of the Strait of Georgia. This device is a Fluorometer Turbidity. Fluorometer Turbidity instruments measure chlorophyll fluorescence and turbidity within the same volume of seawater. The instrument uses a light emitting diode (LED) to provide an excitation source. The fluoresced light is received by a detector at a particular angle from the LED source, and uses an interference filter to discriminate against scattered excitation light. Turbidity is measured at the same time, by detecting scattered light from a LED, which is positioned at the same angle as the chlorophyll fluorescence. It was deployed on a fixed platform. Data from this deployment were archived and made available through Ocean Networks Canada's Oceans 3.0 digital infrastructure, with quality assurance and derived data products following established practices.</gco:CharacterString>
        <lan:PT_FreeText>
          <lan:textGroup>
            <lan:LocalisedCharacterString locale="fra">Ce WET Labs ECO FLNTUSB 2473 a été déployé le 2012-02-25 au Strait of Georgia East. Strait of Georgia East désigne une zone est du le Strait of Georgia. Cet instrument est un Fluorimètre et Turbidité. Les instruments de fluorimètre et turbidité (FLNTU) sont dotés d'un capteur combiné qui mesure la fluorescence et la turbidité de la chlorophylle dans le même volume d'eau de mer. L'instrument utilise une diode électroluminescente (DEL) pour fournir une source d'excitation. La lumière fluorescente est reçue par un détecteur à un angle particulier à partir de la source DEL et utilise un filtre d'interférence pour distinguer la lumière d'excitation dispersée. La turbidité est mesurée en même temps, en détectant la lumière diffusée à partir d'une DEL, qui est positionnée au même angle que la fluorescence chlorophylle. Il a été deployé sur une plateforme fixe. Les données de ce déploiement sont archivées et accessibles sur l’infrastructure numérique Oceans 3.0 du Réseau Canadien des Océans (ONC), avec assurance de la qualité et produits dérivés selon les conventions établies.</lan:LocalisedCharacterString>
          </lan:textGroup>
        </lan:PT_FreeText>
      </mri:abstract>
      <mri:status>
        <mcc:MD_ProgressCode codeList="http://standards.iso.org/iso/19115/resources/Codelist/cat/codelists.xml#MD_ProgressCode" codeListValue="completed"/>
      </mri:status>
      <mri:topicCategory>
        <mri:MD_TopicCategoryCode>oceans</mri:MD_TopicCategoryCode>
      </mri:topicCategory>

        <gco:CharacterString>Previous metadata record [dataset title: English = Strait of Georgia East Fluorometer Turbidity Deployed 2012-02-25, dataset title: French = Strait of Georgia East Fluorimètre et Turbidité déployé 2012-02-25, abstract: English = The WET Labs ECO FLNTUSB 2473 was deployed on 2012-02-25 at Strait of Georgia East. Strait of Georgia East refers to an eastern area of the Strait of Georgia. This device is a Fluorometer Turbidity. Fluorometer Turbidity instruments measure chlorophyll fluorescence and turbidity within the same volume of seawater. The instrument uses a light emitting diode (LED) to provide an excitation source. The fluoresced light is received by a detector at a particular angle from the LED source, and uses an interference filter to discriminate against scattered excitation light. Turbidity is measured at the same time, by detecting scattered light from a LED, which is positioned at the same angle as the chlorophyll fluorescence. It was deployed on a fixed platform. Data from this deployment were archived and made available through Ocean Networks Canada's Oceans 3.0 digital infrastructure, with quality assurance and derived data products following established practices., abstract: French = Ce WET Labs ECO FLNTUSB 2473 a été déployé le 2012-02-25 au Strait of Georgia East. Fluorometer Turbidity instruments measure chlorophyll fluorescence and turbidity within the same volume of seawater. The instrument uses a light emitting diode (LED) to provide an excitation source. The fluoresced light is received by a detector at a particular angle from the LED source, and uses an interference filter to discriminate against scattered excitation light. Turbidity is measured at the same time, by detecting scattered light from a LED, which is positioned at the same angle as the chlorophyll fluorescence. It was deployed on a fixed platform. Data from this deployment were archived and made available through Ocean Networks Canada's Oceans 3.0 digital infrastructure, with quality assurance and derived data products following established practices., abstract: French = Ce WET Labs ECO FLNTUSB 2473 a été déployé le 2012-02-25 au Strait of Georgia East. Strait of Georgia East désigne une zone est du le Strait of Georgia. Cet instrument est un Fluorimètre et Turbidité. Les instruments de fluorimètre et turbidité (FLNTU) sont dotés d'un capteur combiné qui mesure la fluorescence et la turbidité de la chlorophylle dans le même volume d'eau de mer. L'instrument utilise une diode électroluminescente (DEL) pour fournir une source d'excitation. La lumière fluorescente est reçue par un détecteur à un angle particulier à partir de la source DEL et utilise un filtre d'interférence pour distinguer la lumière d'excitation dispersée. La turbidité est mesurée en même temps, en détectant la lumière diffusée à partir d'une DEL, qui est positionnée au même angle que la fluorescence chlorophylle. Il a été deployé sur une plateforme fixe. Les données de ce déploiement sont archivées et accessibles sur l’infrastructure numérique Oceans 3.0 du Réseau Canadien des Océans (ONC), avec assurance de la qualité et produits dérivés selon les conventions établies.]</gco:CharacterString>
      </mmi:maintenanceNote>
    </mmi:MD_MaintenanceInformation>

              <mcc:authority>

                  <cit:title>
                    <gco:CharacterString>Ocean Networks Canada Society</gco:CharacterString>
                  </cit:title>
                  <cit:onlineResource>
                    <cit:CI_OnlineResource>
                      <cit:linkage>
                        <gco:CharacterString>https://data.oceannetworks.ca/DeviceListing?DeviceId=1304</gco:CharacterString>

          <mac:type>
            <gco:CharacterString>WETLabs ECO-FLNTU combined fluorometer and turbidity sensor</gco:CharacterString>
          </mac:type>
          <mac:description>
            <gco:CharacterString>The ECO-FLNTU combines the ECO fluorometer with an optical scattering measurement at 700nm for simultaneous determination of turbidity. The fluorometer can typically measure phytoplankton concentrations in the range 0.01-50 ug/l, with a sensitivity of 0.01 ug/l. The turbidity sensor can measure within the range 0.01-25 NTU, with a sensitivity of 0.01 NTU. The instrument is stable over a temperature range of 0-20 degC and is rated to a depth of 600 m as standard, with the option of a 'deep' instrument rated to 6000m.</gco:CharacterString>
          </mac:description>
        </mac:MI_Instrument>
      </mac:instrument>

name: 9e2ddbf2-4846-4807-9ea5-0a12ae6a122c
notes: The WET Labs ECO FLNTUSB 2473 was deployed on 2012-02-25 at Strait of Georgia East. Strait of Georgia East refers to an eastern area of the Strait of Georgia. This device is a Fluorometer Turbidity. Fluorometer Turbidity instruments measure chlorophyll fluorescence and turbidity within the same volume of seawater. The instrument uses a light emitting diode (LED) to provide an excitation source. The fluoresced light is received by a detector at a particular angle from the LED source, and uses an interference filter to discriminate against scattered excitation light. Turbidity is measured at the same time, by detecting scattered light from a LED, which is positioned at the same angle as the chlorophyll fluorescence. It was deployed on a fixed platform. Data from this deployment were archived and made available through Ocean Networks Canada's Oceans 3.0 digital infrastructure, with quality assurance and derived data products following established practices.

notes_translated.en: The WET Labs ECO FLNTUSB 2473 was deployed on 2012-02-25 at Strait of Georgia East. Strait of Georgia East refers to an eastern area of the Strait of Georgia. This device is a Fluorometer Turbidity. Fluorometer Turbidity instruments measure chlorophyll fluorescence and turbidity within the same volume of seawater. The instrument uses a light emitting diode (LED) to provide an excitation source. The fluoresced light is received by a detector at a particular angle from the LED source, and uses an interference filter to discriminate against scattered excitation light. Turbidity is measured at the same time, by detecting scattered light from a LED, which is positioned at the same angle as the chlorophyll fluorescence. It was deployed on a fixed platform. Data from this deployment were archived and made available through Ocean Networks Canada's Oceans 3.0 digital infrastructure, with quality assurance and derived data products following established practices.
notes_translated.fr: Ce WET Labs ECO FLNTUSB 2473 a été déployé le 2012-02-25 au Strait of Georgia East. Strait of Georgia East désigne une zone est du le Strait of Georgia. Cet instrument est un Fluorimètre et Turbidité. Les instruments de fluorimètre et turbidité (FLNTU) sont dotés d'un capteur combiné qui mesure la fluorescence et la turbidité de la chlorophylle dans le même volume d'eau de mer. L'instrument utilise une diode électroluminescente (DEL) pour fournir une source d'excitation. La lumière fluorescente est reçue par un détecteur à un angle particulier à partir de la source DEL et utilise un filtre d'interférence pour distinguer la lumière d'excitation dispersée. La turbidité est mesurée en même temps, en détectant la lumière diffusée à partir d'une DEL, qui est positionnée au même angle que la fluorescence chlorophylle. Il a été deployé sur une plateforme fixe. Les données de ce déploiement sont archivées et accessibles sur l’infrastructure numérique Oceans 3.0 du Réseau Canadien des Océans (ONC), avec assurance de la qualité et produits dérivés selon les conventions établies.

description_translated.en: The Canadian Integrated Ocean Observing System (CIOOS) Pacific is the regional hub of the National CIOOS for ocean data aggregation on Canada’s west coast.
description_translated.fr: Le Système intégré d’observation des océans canadien (SIOOC) Pacifique est la plaque tournante régionale du SIOOC national pour l’agrégation des données océaniques sur la côte ouest du Canada.

title: Strait of Georgia East Fluorometer Turbidity Deployed 2012-02-25

description.fr: Accueil des données canadiennes sur l'océan Pacifique
description.en: Home of Canada's Pacific Ocean Data

resources.description: Data is delivered via ERDDAP, a data server that gives a standardized way to download subsets of datasets in common file formats. This particular ERDDAP installation has oceanographic data from Ocean Networks Canada's instruments

description_translated.en: Data is delivered via ERDDAP, a data server that gives a standardized way to download subsets of datasets in common file formats. This particular ERDDAP installation has oceanographic data from Ocean Networks Canada's instruments
